datafield.subfield: Monash University. School of Business and Economics
The Tourism Market's Response to the 2009 Black Saturday Bushfires: The Case of Gippsland, 2010 :
(Gabrielle Walters, Valerie Clulow; authors of journal article, Journal of Travel & Tourism Marketing , vol. 27, no. 8, pp. 844-857, 2010)

(Professor Val Clulow joined the College of Business, at RMIT University in October 2011, as Deputy Pro Vice-Chancellor, Learning and Teaching. Professor Clulow has previously held a number of senior management positions within business faculties at Australian universities and prior to joining RMIT University she was Professor and Head, School of Business and Economics, Monash University, Gippsland/Campus Director Global Engagement for 7 years. Prior to her academic career, Professor Clulow had extensive industry experience in retail management training and consultancy. Professor Clulow holds a PhD from the University of Melbourne (Centre for Studies in Higher Education) and has published widely across three areas - business education, marketing and business strategy and undertaken several industry/government consultancies. She is a trained teacher and holds a Masters degree in Education (distance education) from the University of South Australia. She has supervised staff and research students extensively to PhD completion, co-authored and received special commendation for developing research capacity.
